name: Tough Ancient Civilizations Quiz | 10 Questions | History

questions.text: Which tribe of the Benin area referred to themselves as 'those who are the real architects of the world'?
questions.explanation:
Battamaliba.

	Ornate and circular huts they created, and with surrounding peoples in the region created a 'Black Byzantium'.

questions.text: Which civilization in the Americas created the oldest sculpture of enormous heads circa 13th century B.C.?
A civilization composed of city-states, often embroiled in bloody civil wars, they are believed to have originated from the loins of a ceiba tree; who might these fellows be?
questions.explanation:
Mayan.

	Known for the Pacal Palenque, and the inscriptions in Copal - which are the largest stone inscriptions in the world. Tikal was probably the greatest Mayan city, circa 1139 AD, where their meteoric rise around 400 BC was eventually followed by their sudden extinction.

questions.text: Abraham marvelled at the towering ziggurats and hedonistic wealth of which of these civilizations?
Nebuchadnezzar created the 'Hanging Gardens' while residing amongst which civilization?
'The First Emperor' utilized 700,000 laborers to build the largest system of roads and walls of this civilization circa 200 B.C.; which country was he from?
questions.explanation:
China.

	'The First Emperor' in question was Qin Shi Huangdi...not really the first emperor, but the first to unite China into one solid unit.

questions.text: The first culture of this civilization was the Jomon, who created marvelous pottery...in which modern country did they reside?
From which civilization did Pythagoras borrow the 'Pythagorean Theorem'?
The concept of 'nous' was established by Anaxogoras and Aristotle to explain the formation of the Universe from a single origin. What civilization produced these great minds?
questions.correct: Ancient Greece & Greece & Greek & Greeks & Acheans
questions.explanation: Ancient Greece & Greece & Greek & Greeks & Acheans.
